analysis: The documents all pertain to exemptions from mandatory retirement for government employees. Each document cites the same legal authority (section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932) and grants a one-year exemption. The employees work in different departments (Bureau of Mines, Government Printing Office, Bureau of Internal Revenue) and have different roles (instrument maker, assistant foreman, special agent). All exemptions are granted by President Franklin D. Roosevelt.
title: One-Year Retirement Exemptions for Government Employees
